subject: AW: [junit] doubt
msgSnippet: start the swing TestRunner: java junit.swingui.TestRunner and try to add your test method to the class name by using a , (Comma) mytest.FooTest,testBar where
messageBody:
start the swing TestRunner:

java junit.swingui.TestRunner

and try to add your test method to the class name by using a "," (Comma)

mytest.FooTest,testBar

where mytest.FooTest is your class and testBar a method in it.



Christian


>
> hello every one,
> i'm new in using junit.
> i have created a class in which there are around 10 test methods(test
> cases), and when i'm running it,it will run the whole class.
> is there any way, so that i can run only 1 method at a time(or
> selected no. of methods)?, i require this for debugging my code.
> and i want to use gui version of the junit, not txt format.
>
> thanks
> faiya
